title.narrative: IMPROVED LEARNING OUTCOMES IN CHILD-FRIENDLY SCHOOLS AND Early Child Development (ECD) CENTRES

description.narrative: Teachers and school management in early childhood education centres, elementary and primary schools have improved skills to deliver child-friendly education and learning outcomes including for out-of-school children in rural and remote areas in selected provinces. , which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, school aged girls and boy, especially the most marginalized, successfully complete pre-primary and primary education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Teachers and school management in early childhood education centres, elementary and primary schools have improved skills to deliverchild-friendly education and learning outcomes including for out-of-school children in rural and remote areas in selected provinces.

description.narrative: Despite the COVID-19 pandemic, the effort to expand ECE services continued. In the partnership with PNGEI, an additional five inclusive ECE model centres were established in Mt Hagen. Planning to replenish ECE demonstration schools in NCD and Helsbach are underway, promoting further inclusion and child-friendly inclusion education for young children in the country. In addition, the Behaviour Management Policy was officially launched, and the Safe School Initiative established 30 school clubs and reached 2,511 primary school children to promote positive attitudes and behaviours among students and eliminate violence against women and girls in school. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021
